meaning_str.bing:
n. 电子邮件（通信方式）；用电子邮件
v. （给…）发电子邮件；用电邮发送
网络. 电邮地址；电子信箱

电子邮件（通信方式）；用电子邮件

1.en: Gone would be the long weekends back in my hometown where I don't even bother checking my email or anything else.
1.cn: 每个周末回我的家乡去，我在那里没有收发电子邮件和别的什么麻烦。

2.en: On this point, one of your self-proclaimed supporters (email attached) actually puts the amount of your article that matches mine at 60%.
2.cn: 对此，你的自称支持者之一（见所附电邮）还将之定量在60%。

3.en: Tell your friends to vote and forward this email to any Justin fans you know.
3.cn: 告诉你的朋友们一起参加选举，电子邮件转寄这对任何贾斯汀球迷你知道的。

0.en: I got that email from Rich yesterday. He's really good.
0.cn: 我昨天收到了瑞奇的电子邮件，这是非常不错的。

1.en: I wrote a long and passionate email, arguing that they should change their policies.
1.cn: 我回了一长篇饱含激情的电子邮件。告诉他们应当改变这一做法。

2.en: Last year, I got an email from a woman named Amy Williams, in Augusta, Georgia.
2.cn: 去年,我收一封来自乔治亚州奥古斯塔一名妇女的电子邮件,她叫艾米威廉姆斯。

3.en: Batroc was hired anonymously to attack the Lemurian Star and he was contacted by email and paid by wire transfer.
3.cn: 巴托克被匿名雇佣袭击利莫里亚之星，他们用电子邮件联系，费用是电子转账的。

4.en: That's not an email. That's Leslie's Facebook page.
4.cn: 才不是邮件呢，你在看莱斯利的FACEBOOK主页。

5.en: Hey, I got an email from Professor Proton. Goody! What's it say?
5.cn: 嘿，质子教授给我发了一封邮件。好呀! 他说什么?

6.en: The email I read said administrative aid. Nope, mail room. I'm gonna go.
6.cn: 邮件上说职位是行政助理？不，是收发室。我还是告辞了。

7.en: Come on. Let's go. You guys go ahead. I just have to finish up an email.
7.cn: 我们走吧。你们先去，我还有封邮件要回。

8.en: My users think I have sent every text and personal email over to the United States Government.
8.cn: 我的用户以为我把每条短信和私人邮件都发送给了美国政府。

9.en: I've just spotted new activity on an old email account that Morris had before he went to prison.
9.cn: 我刚刚发现一个老电邮账户有动静，这是莫里斯进监狱之前的账户。

10.en: Oh, I got two emails from him. "Do you have Leonard's email address?" And "Never mind, I found it."
10.cn: 哦，他给我发了两封邮件， "你有Leonard的邮箱地址吗?"还有... "不要紧 我找到了"。

11.en: And every time you didn't meet one of those candidates, everyday that's passed without you calling them, email them, sending them flowers, they will be that much less likely to talk to you next time.
11.cn: 当你没有再和那些”可能的对象”见面，日复一日，你没有给他们打电话，没有发邮件，也没有送花，你们进行下一次对话的可能性就越来越小。
